org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientHandler
extends Object
implements Runnable

Worker thread for the server that is dedicated to a single client.

Sets up a child thread that listens for client input, while pinging the client to test connection. Since Java cannot detect if a client closes the TCP connection, we manually test the connection by pinging the client. If the client does not respond with pingPongTimeoutMs, the server assumes the connection went dead.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
InputHandler, SwiftSocketServer, checkPing(), checkPong()

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ClientHandler

protected ClientHandler(SwiftSocketServer server,
                        ClientContext clientContext,
                        boolean pingPongMode,
                        int pingPongIntervalMs,
                        int pingPongTimeoutMs)
Constructor, which accepts a SwiftSocketServer instance and a client ClientContext. Also resets ClientContext.getPingtime() and ClientContext.isPongReceived() flags.

Parameters:
server - Server used to check on the server status (ie. server is stopping).
pingPongMode - Indicates whether to perform PingPong polling to the client to detect drop outs.
clientContext - The context containing the client socket to which this worker thread is dedicated to.
pingPongIntervalMs - The Ping Pong interval used if pingPongMode is turned on.
pingPongTimeoutMs - The Ping Pong timeout used if pingPongMode is turned on.
Method Detail

run

public final void run()
Thread method that runs ping messages to the client and tests for timeouts. Also sets up client thread that waits for input; a new thread is used since this action is blocking and the thread 'sleeps' until input is available, which would deny us the opportunity to do ping messages.

Keeps pinging the client while the server is running.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable
See Also:
Runnable.run(), checkPing(), checkPong(), SwiftSocketServer.isRunning()

pong

public final void pong()
Invoked by ClientMessageToServerPingPong.execute(ClientHandler), when the client is responding with a pong notification. Sets ClientContext.setPongReceived(boolean) to true, which is used to determine ping timeout with.

See Also:
ClientContext.setPongReceived(boolean), checkPong(), ClientMessageToServerPingPong

clientSaysByeBye

protected void clientSaysByeBye()
Called by ClientMessageToServerByeBye.execute(ClientHandler). Set the 'Bye Bye' lag on the clientContext and calls ClientEndpoint.close().

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(ServerMessageToClient message)
Logs and sends a response message to the current client using clientContext, delegating the actual sending to sendMessage(ClientContext, int, ServerMessageToClient), unless the client has said 'Bye Bye' in which case the message to be sent is ignored altogether.

Parameters:
message - The server message to send to the client.
See Also:
ClientContext.isClientSaidByeBye(), sendMessage(ClientContext, int, ServerMessageToClient)

getClientContext

public ClientContext getClientContext()
Returns:
The clientContext containing session data for external use.
